*Last updated on: `r Sys.Date()`*

Complete G&W coverage population data for 1816 to 2020. Preferentially from UN data for post-1949 data, with drop-ins from WDI and KSG; for pre-1950 KSG data. 

## Usage

```{r}
library("dplyr")
library("ggplot2")
library("states")

pop <- read_csv("output/population.csv")
str(pop)
head(pop)

plot_missing(pop, x = "pop", ccode = "gwcode", time = "year", statelist = "GW")

pop %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = year, y = pop, group = gwcode)) +
  geom_line(alpha = .5) +
  scale_y_log10() + 
  theme_minimal()

data("gwstates")
still_missing <- pop %>%
  filter(is.na(pop)) %>%
  group_by(gwcode) %>%
  summarize(year = paste0(range(year), collapse = " - "),
            n = n()) %>%
  left_join(gwstates, by = "gwcode") %>%
  select(gwcode, country_name, year, n)
still_missing
```
